_comment: Created by rreed on 05/01/2017 15:05:23 using v2.7
title: How does five-year cervical cancer survival in the UK compare to other countries?
analysis_commentary: International trends in five-year relative survival for cervical cancer show more cross country variation over time than for five-year relative breast cancer survival. While survival has been improving in the UK, the country is still one of the worst performers relative to the other OECD countries included, with a five-year survival of only 60.9% in 2007-2012. This is despite a relatively high cervical cancer screening coverage. In comparison, survival in Sweden in the same year was 67.3% while survival in Korea reached 76.8% in 2005-2010.
data_source: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, Health Data
